\subsection{Member Data Documentation}
\hypertarget{classchaos_1_1str_1_1_u_string_a67b8f0f4465be46fa0035f617b438bce}{\index{chaos\-::str\-::\-U\-String@{chaos\-::str\-::\-U\-String}!default\-Input\-Encoding@{default\-Input\-Encoding}}
\index{default\-Input\-Encoding@{default\-Input\-Encoding}!chaos::str::UString@{chaos\-::str\-::\-U\-String}}
\subsubsection[{default\-Input\-Encoding}]{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}U\-String\-::\-Encoding chaos\-::str\-::\-U\-String\-::default\-Input\-Encoding = U\-String\-::\-E\-N\-C\-O\-D\-I\-N\-G\-\_\-\-U\-T\-F8\hspace{0.3cm}{\ttfamily [static]}}}\label{classchaos_1_1str_1_1_u_string_a67b8f0f4465be46fa0035f617b438bce}
The default encoding that input data will be provided in. This value is initially set to E\-N\-C\-O\-D\-I\-N\-G\-\_\-\-U\-T\-F8 on Unix systems and E\-N\-C\-O\-D\-I\-N\-G\-\_\-\-U\-T\-F16 on Windows systems.

For example if this value is set to E\-N\-C\-O\-D\-I\-N\-G\-\_\-\-U\-T\-F8, creating a \hyperlink{classchaos_1_1str_1_1_u_string}{U\-String} with\-: 
\begin{DoxyCode}
\hyperlink{classchaos_1_1str_1_1_u_string}{chaos::str::UString}( \textcolor{stringliteral}{"Ἦλθον, εἶδον, ἐνίκησα"} );
\end{DoxyCode}
 will assume the provided char array data is encoded with utf-\/8 \hypertarget{classchaos_1_1str_1_1_u_string_af2df9ef0080748c1ca4802fd8285d5bc}{\index{chaos\-::str\-::\-U\-String@{chaos\-::str\-::\-U\-String}!default\-Input\-Width@{default\-Input\-Width}}
\index{default\-Input\-Width@{default\-Input\-Width}!chaos::str::UString@{chaos\-::str\-::\-U\-String}}
\subsubsection[{default\-Input\-Width}]{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}U\-String\-::\-Data\-Width chaos\-::str\-::\-U\-String\-::default\-Input\-Width = U\-String\-::\-D\-A\-T\-A\-W\-I\-D\-T\-H\-\_\-8\hspace{0.3cm}{\ttfamily [static]}}}\label{classchaos_1_1str_1_1_u_string_af2df9ef0080748c1ca4802fd8285d5bc}
The default bit width of each character that input data will be provided in. This value is initially set to D\-A\-T\-A\-W\-I\-D\-T\-H\-\_\-8.

For example if this value was set to D\-A\-T\-A\-W\-I\-D\-T\-H\-\_\-8, creating a \hyperlink{classchaos_1_1str_1_1_u_string}{U\-String} with\-: 
\begin{DoxyCode}
\hyperlink{classchaos_1_1str_1_1_u_string}{chaos::str::UString}( \textcolor{stringliteral}{"Ἦλθον, εἶδον, ἐνίκησα"} );
\end{DoxyCode}
 would correctly read that data. Even though most of the characters are stored across two 8-\/bit chars\-: the data is represented in an array of 8-\/bit chars.

Whereas creating a \hyperlink{classchaos_1_1str_1_1_u_string}{U\-String} with\-: 
\begin{DoxyCode}
\hyperlink{classchaos_1_1str_1_1_u_string}{chaos::str::UString}( u\textcolor{stringliteral}{"Ἦλθον, εἶδον, ἐνίκησα"} );
\end{DoxyCode}
 would cause problems since the data is nor represented with an array of 16-\/bit wide chars. To solve this you would need to either explicitly pass the data width to the constructor through a \hyperlink{structchaos_1_1str_1_1_u_string_1_1_data_definition}{Data\-Definition} struct, or change this default value. \hypertarget{classchaos_1_1str_1_1_u_string_aca40d2341d3b5011070beede74fb3c05}{\index{chaos\-::str\-::\-U\-String@{chaos\-::str\-::\-U\-String}!default\-Stored\-Encoding@{default\-Stored\-Encoding}}
\index{default\-Stored\-Encoding@{default\-Stored\-Encoding}!chaos::str::UString@{chaos\-::str\-::\-U\-String}}
\subsubsection[{default\-Stored\-Encoding}]{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}U\-String\-::\-Encoding chaos\-::str\-::\-U\-String\-::default\-Stored\-Encoding = U\-String\-::\-E\-N\-C\-O\-D\-I\-N\-G\-\_\-\-U\-T\-F8\hspace{0.3cm}{\ttfamily [static]}}}\label{classchaos_1_1str_1_1_u_string_aca40d2341d3b5011070beede74fb3c05}
